data.title: Best Prime Rib in the Tri-Valley
data.text: The Brass Door has been around forever and there's a very good reason why, their prime rib is always cooked to perfection.  I'm an English girl who likes her meat well done, end cut please!  My husband is at the other end of the spectrum, and likes his rare.  Each and everytime The Brass Door amazes me and our prime rib is exactly the way we like it.  Their warm garlic bread tickles your tastebuds and their salads are always fresh and crisp.  If you're not a meat eater, no worries, there is something for everyone on their menu.  They offer a variety of salads, (including a delicious real crab, crab louie), pasta, chicken dishes, fresh seafood, sandwiches, steaks and so forth.  And if you are one of those who like liver and onions, well, they have that too.  And from what I hear, it's pretty amazing.

data.title: Comfort food
data.text: Great steaks, chops, and prime rib. The salads and soups are very good. An old-line place where you feel comfortable.

data.title: Annivarsary
data.text: Excellent service and wonderful food.  A great place to celebrate any occaision.  This is one that you will want to go back to.

data.title: COMFORT FOOD
data.text: Step back into the 60's with the décor, bar and great wait staff. Food is consistently good and drinks are not watered down. I've been going to this restaurant for many years and it's a great place for family's, couples, group occasions or just stop in for a cocktail.

data.title: Good home cooking and Great garlic bread
data.text: This is an old fashioned place. It has been around for a long time. The food is good and they have a good variety. Not too much for the Vegan though if that's your thing. It reminds me of a restaurant from back east. I like that they have what they call "senior" meals but it;s just a smaller portion. They have good prime rib on the weekends. The bar is an adult bar as I would call it. It's for talking and socializing. There are some TV's on for the sports watchers but it isn't a sports bar.

data.title: Just not my kind of place.
data.text:
I've read some positive reviews of this place and that is what prompted me to recommend and take my father and a family friend to lunch here. From the outside you cannot really gauge what the interior environment will be as it is not easy to look inside from the parking lot. Any windows are facing the street side which seem to be well cordoned off by trees so you don't have to look at the passing traffic which is thoughtful. That's about all I have to say that is positive. After that it kind of goes downhill. It's all about first impressions and for me, they scored low at each experience marker.
Walking in the door: Well, the Brass Door is no longer a Brass Door. Which immediately sent me a subliminal message that this was a place that was still living in it's own past. Yes, there were photos and memorabilia in the entry showing you that in fact, there had actually been a Brass Door, it USED to be a place where San Ramon would dine and celebrate. It SMELLED like it had been a long time since the carpets were cleaned OR they have a bad case of bar rot behind the bar. Just a really distracting scent of mold / mildew and OLD. 

That did not really make me want to stay and eat lunch to be honest but I thought that maybe I was jumping the gun and would miss a memorable meal by pre judging the situation before giving it a chance.

In hindsight I truly wish I would have listened to my inner voice.

The menu is reminiscent of the old Steak House / Martini Lunch Spot with the obligatory Surf and Turf type combo offered, Prime Rib on the Dinner menu, and Clam Chowder as an old steady.

Done well this is actually making a comeback. However, the Clam Chowder was barely warm (not really sure what the problem was: broken soup warmer or was it allowed to sit out after being portioned??) and the rest of the meal was not particularly appetizing. Everything had a "hologram" quality to it in that it was a representation of a dish and not actually done well enough to actually BE the dish.

My father was new in town and I was actually embarrassed that I had recommended this place. I apologized to him. He said that he had made a reservation there for dinner in case we wanted to come back as he was wanted to treat us (he made the reservation BEFORE we had eaten anything, I guess he did it when he excused himself to visit the restroom), however, after the experience, we cancelled the reservation.

I am sorry as this is bound to upset some of the loyal customer base they must have but this was just one of the worst dining experiences I have had. Luckily I did not get sick from the under temp Clam Chowder. There are just too many red flags going up for me there. I cannot in good conscience let it go without comment.

I hope they push themselves to correct their opportunities and take a moment to view the facility with a fresh perspective and see what needs a good sweep, scour and scrub. EVERYONE can benefit from that. Gordon Ramsay would have a field day in this place.

Unfortunately Disappointed.

data.title: Real good old fashioned food
data.text:
I have been here for Brunch and dinner. Never disappointed with my meal. Generous portions and it tastes like they just cooked the meal for me.
The waitresses are very friendly and attentive. She noticed I ate most of the bread (complimentary) and right away she offered to bring me a box and give me more to take home!
They also offer Senior Portions.

data.title: dinner with friends
data.text: It has been a long time since I have gone to dinner there, but always enjoy my food and the service is very good.

data.title: Tried and true always great meals.
data.text: Favorite spot to meet up with friends, especially for birthdays. New Owners have maintained the menu and service and bring that down home welcome feel to the restaurant. Still a favorite place for the locals.

data.title: Nice food and great atmosphere
data.text: We enjoyed a nice dinner of grilled prawns, stuff calamari with crab and shrimp.  We also enjoyed the nice clean atmosphere and very good service.

data.title: Love the Prime Rib Sandwich
data.text:
This is one of my favorite sandwiches.  Juicy!     

I love the old school atmosphere of this place but we forewarned that the patronage are 90% silver hairs and they seem to expect large parties to be quiet.  My large party of 8 was shushed at 8pm by a patron.  This didn't go over well.  My advice - if you want a quiet dinner in large dining room at a popular establishment, eat at 5 or 6pm, not between 7-10pm.

data.title: Dinner hour
data.text: Good food.  Consistant quality.  Wait staff is very experienced.  Convenient parking, full bar service, and variety in the menu.

data.title: If you like beef - this is your place
data.text: This is more of a local getaway than a tourist restaurant.  The menu is very meat oriented.  I had the stroganoff and it was quite good.  The prime rid looked great and the bar was very quaint.

data.title: Just OK
data.text:
Good service, nice interior, but my prime rib was just fair and very overcooked.. I didn't try any other food. It may be good and I just got unlucky They have a very good reputation and the service was good. Also a bit pricey, so I expected more.

I would give it another try on a different entree.

data.title: Very average
data.text:
San Ramon does not have many good restaurants . This one has average food with good service. The atmosphere is a real throwback to the 70's. Most of the patrons are seniors as is the  staff as well. Pleasant bartender making decent drinks . $32 Filet was very over cooked.  Calamari appetizer was 
the best part of the meal.

data.title: Good Old Fashion Americana
data.text:
I love this place.  Not because it's fancy but because its a throw back to the 70s. 
The steaks and Primeribs are on point. The servers are representative of that era as well.  You will get called Honey when least expected but I think that's the charm. 
The sides are all fresh and home cooked goodness. 
I'm not a big pasta guy but one of the the friends really liked his too. Oh, and I think this place has the most amazing baked potatoes.

data.title: Old school, old clientele, but really good steaks!
data.text: Exceptional meats and side dishes.  Crab cakes are lovely.  If you are under 50 you'll be the youngest person in the joint but even so, the old school personality of this long-time establishment gives it some charm.  Reasonably priced and a solid bar staff also a plus.  Worthwhile to dine at if in the area.

data.title: DINNER AT THE BRASS DOOR
data.text: The facility is old,  but very well maintained.   The food was marginal,  not bad but not great.   If you want a veal cutlet, you need to go somewhere else.  It was about an eight of an inch thick and overcooked.  The salad and bread are good.   Chicken piccata and calamari steak are average.  They do have senior rates.   I would make a return trip, but make a better selection

data.title: Comfort food
data.text: Appears like the place the locals go. Service? Terrific-They treat you like you come in every day. We were only visiting the area. Fried chicken  mashed potatoes and carrots was very good and fresh .Chicken piccante, mashed potatoes and cooked carrots- senior portion, tasty, good portion and came with a salad, very good value. Grand daughter -Hambuger, it was huge. Lots of variety on the menu. Comfortable setting . Not for those dieting. We will be back next time we are  in the area.

data.title: Scrum-diddley-umptious!!!
data.text:
Some dear friends "kidnapped" me on 5/18/16 and treated me to a wonderful birthday lunch!!    My dear hubby and I used to frequent the Brass Door before he passed away, in 2003.  I had not been back to this restaurant since.....until my dear friends took me there to celebrate my birthday.  I was soooo surprised to see (when we first walked in) we were greeted by a waitress who I immediately recognized from days past....and she also remembered me.....wonderful feeling.   We were seated in a very private area and immediately offered something to drink.  The atmosphere was very pleasant and the quietness allowed for "catch-up conversation" with my friends.   Everything on the menu sounded so good to me, but I settled for the pan fried sea scallops and substituted au gratin potatoes for the French fries.  When our food arrived, I was delighted that the scallops were the large sea scallops (not the little bay scallops) and were "done to a turn."  They were so yummy, as was the au gratin potato and the cabbage salad.   Our waitress was super attentive and my friends LOVED their entries, as well.   I must say that it was wonderful to dine there again and to know that they are living up to my fond memories of this fine restaurant!
Bon Apitito!!
